data.name: BeginSTRClass
data.value: Creating strongly typed resource class "{0}"...

data.name: UnbalancedEndifs
data.value: Found an #endif without a matching #ifdef.

data.name: NoEqualsWithNewLine
data.value: Found a resource that had a new line in it, but couldn't find the equal sign within! Length: {0} name: '{1}'.

data.name: MalformedCompileString
data.value: You must specify an input & outfile file name like this: inFile.txt,outFile.resources. You passed in "{0}".

data.name: NeutralityOfCultureNotPreserved
data.value: This assembly contains neutral resources corresponding to the culture "{0}". These resources will not be considered neutral in the output format as we are unable to preserve this information. The resources will continue to correspond to "{0}" in the output format.

data.name: WarningCount
data.value: {0} warnings(s).

data.name: CreatingCultureInfoFailed
data.value: Creating the CultureInfo failed for assembly "{2}". Note the set of cultures supported is Operating System-dependent, and the Operating System has removed some cultures from time to time (ie, some Serbian cultures are split up in Windows 7). The culture may be a user-defined custom culture that we can't currently load on this machine. Exception info: {0}: {1}

data.name: WriteError
data.value: Couldn't write output file "{0}"

data.name: CannotWriteAssembly
data.value: ResGen cannot write assemblies, only read from them. Cannot create assembly "{0}".

data.name: NoName
data.value: Missing value! Expected a name / value pair like 'name = value'. Name was "{0}"

data.name: FileNotFound
data.value: Couldn't find input file "{0}"

data.name: SatelliteAssemblyContainsNoResourcesFile
data.value: This assembly claims to be a satellite assembly, but doesn't contain any properly named .resources files as manifest resources. The name of the files should end in {0}.resources. There is probably a build-related problem with this assembly.

data.name: CompileSwitchNotSupportedForAssemblies
data.value: /compile is not supported with assemblies (.resources.dll, .dll or .exe) as input. Use ResGen /? for usage information.

data.name: ImproperlyBuiltMainAssembly
data.value: Main assembly "{1}" was built improperly. The manifest resource "{0}" ends in .en-US.resources, when it should end in .resources. Either rename it to something like foo.resources (and consider using the NeutralResourcesLanguageAtribute on the main assembly), or move it to a US English satellite assembly.

data.name: NoResourcesFilesInAssembly
data.value: This assembly claims to contain neutral resources, but doesn't contain any .resources files as manifest resources. Either the NeutralResourcesLanguageAttribute was wrong, or there is a build-related problem with this assembly.

data.name: CannotLoadAssemblyLoadFromFailed
data.value: Loading assembly "{0}" failed. {1}

data.name: UsageOnWindows
data.value:
Microsoft (R) .NET Resource Generator [Microsoft .Net Framework, Version {0}] {1}
Usage: ResGen inputFile.ext [outputFile.ext] [/str:lang[,namespace[,class[,file]]]] ResGen [options] /compile inputFile1.ext[,outputFile1.resources] [...] ResGen inputFile.ext2 [outputDirectory] Where .ext is .resX, .restext, .txt or .resources and .ext2 is .resources.dll, .dll or .exe. outputDirectory must already exist. Resources will be extracted under outputDirectory in resW format.
Converts files from one resource format to another. If the output filename is not specified, inputFile.resources will be used. Options: /compile Converts a list of resource files from one format to another in one bulk operation. By default, it converts into .resources files, using inputFile[i].resources for the output file name. /str:<language>[,<namespace>[,<class name>[,<file name>]]]] Creates a strongly-typed resource class in the specified programming language using CodeDOM. In order for the strongly typed resource class to work properly, the name of your output file without the .resources must match the [namespace.]classname of your strongly typed resource class. You may need to rename your output file before using it or embedding it into an assembly. /useSourcePath Use each source file's directory as the current directory for resolving relative file paths. /publicClass Create the strongly typed resource class as a public class. This option is ignored if the /str: option is not used. /r:<assembly> Load types from these assemblies. A ResX file with a previous version of a type will use the one in this assembly, when set. /define:A[,B] For #ifdef support in .ResText files, pass a comma-separated list of symbols. ResText files can use "#ifdef A" or "#if !B". /allowUntrustedFiles Process files that are in the Internet or Restricted zone or have the mark of the web on the file.
Miscellaneous: @<file> Read response file for more options. At most one response file may be specified, and its entries must be line-separated.
.restext & .txt files have this format:
# Use # at the beginning of a line for a comment character. name=value more elaborate name=value
Example response file contents:
# Use # at the beginning of a line for a comment character. /useSourcePath /compile file1.resx,file1.resources file2.resx,file2.resources

data.name: ReadIn
data.value: Read in {0} resources from "{1}"

data.name: INFFileBracket
data.value: Unexpected INF file bracket syntax - ResGen does not support text in square brackets. Bad text: "[{0}".

data.name: UnmappableResource
data.value: Could not create a property on the strongly typed resource class for the resource name "{0}".

data.name: UnrecognizedUltimateResourceFallbackLocation
data.value: Invalid or unrecognized UltimateResourceFallbackLocation value in the NeutralResourcesLanguageAttribute for assembly "{1}". Location: "{0}"

data.name: DuplicateResourceKey
data.value: Duplicate resource key! Name was: "{0}"

data.name: SatelliteAssemblyContainsCode
data.value: The assembly "{0}" says it is a satellite assembly, but it contains code. Main assemblies shouldn't specify the assembly culture in their manifest, and satellites should not contain code. This is almost certainly an error in your build process.

data.name: InvalidResX
data.value: Invalid format or contents in input. "{0}" error trying to read input.

data.name: OnlyString
data.value: Only strings can be written to a .txt or .restext file; the value of '{0}' is a '{1}'

data.name: BadEscape
data.value: Unsupported or invalid escape character in value! Escape char: '{0}' Name was: "{1}"

data.name: AssemblyNotFullySigned
data.value: Assembly "{0}" isn't fully signed. Please fully sign this assembly using sn.exe before shipping it to customers.

data.name: STRSwitchNotSupportedForAssemblies
data.value: /str is not supported with assemblies (.resources.dll, .dll or .exe) as input. Use ResGen /? for usage information.

data.name: InvalidCommandLineSyntax
data.value: Invalid command line syntax. Switch: "{0}" Bad value: "{1}". Use ResGen /? for usage information.

data.name: DuplicateOutputFilenames
data.value: Two output filenames resolved to the same output path: "{0}"

data.name: NoEquals
data.value: Found an equals sign at beginning of a line! Expected a name / value pair like 'name = value'

data.name: BadImageFormat
data.value: Did not recognize "{0}" as a managed assembly.

data.name: MalformedResponseFileEntry
data.value: Response files must be line-delimited; "{0}" contains "{1}".

data.name: GenericWriteError
data.value: Error while writing the output file "{0}"

data.name: ErrorCount
data.value: {0} error(s).

data.name: DoneDot
data.value: Done.

data.name: BadFileExtensionOnWindows
data.value: The file named "{0}" does not have a known extension. Managed resource files must end in .ResX, .restext, .txt, .resources, .resources.dll, .dll or .exe. Response files must end in .rsp and be specified as @respFile.rsp.

data.name: UsageNotOnWindows
data.value:
Microsoft (R) .NET Resource Generator [Microsoft .Net Framework, Version {0}] {1}
Usage: ResGen inputFile.ext [outputFile.ext] [/str:lang[,namespace[,class[,file]]]] ResGen [options] /compile inputFile1.ext[,outputFile1.resources] [...]
Where .ext is .resX, .restext, .txt, or .resources
Converts files from one resource format to another. If the output filename is not specified, inputFile.resources will be used. Options: /compile Converts a list of resource files from one format to another in one bulk operation. By default, it converts into .resources files, using inputFile[i].resources for the output file name. /str:<language>[,<namespace>[,<class name>[,<file name>]]]] Creates a strongly-typed resource class in the specified programming language using CodeDOM. In order for the strongly typed resource class to work properly, the name of your output file without the .resources must match the [namespace.]classname of your strongly typed resource class. You may need to rename your output file before using it or embedding it into an assembly. /useSourcePath Use each source file's directory as the current directory for resolving relative file paths. /publicClass Create the strongly typed resource class as a public class. This option is ignored if the /str: option is not used. /r:<assembly> Load types from these assemblies. A ResX file with a previous version of a type will use the one in this assembly, when set. /define:A[,B] For #ifdef support in .ResText files, pass a comma-separated list of symbols. ResText files can use "#ifdef A" or "#if !B".
Miscellaneous: @<file> Read response file for more options. At most one response file may be specified, and its entries must be line-separated.
.restext & .txt files have this format:
# Use # at the beginning of a line for a comment character. name=value more elaborate name=value
Example response file contents:
# Use # at the beginning of a line for a comment character. /useSourcePath /compile file1.resx,file1.resources file2.resx,file2.resources

data.name: MissingFileLocation
data.value: Can't verify assembly without a file location.

data.name: SatelliteOrMalformedAssembly
data.value: The assembly in file "{0}" has an assembly culture, indicating it is a satellite assembly for culture "{1}". But satellite assembly simple names must end in ".resources", while this one's simple name is "{2}". This is either a main assembly with the culture incorrectly set, or a satellite assembly with an incorrect simple name.

data.name: UnknownFileExtension
data.value: Unknown file extension "{0}" for file "{1}"

data.name: CantLoadAssembly
data.value: Could not load referenced assembly "{0}". Caught a {1} saying "{2}".

data.name: NoResourcesFileInAssembly
data.value: Couldn't find the linked resources file "{0}" listed in the assembly manifest.

data.name: BadCommandLineOption
data.value: Unrecognized switch: "{0}". Use ResGen /? for usage information.

data.name: DeleteOutputFileFailed
data.value: Could not delete possibly corrupted output file "{0}".

data.name: SpecificError
data.value: Specific exception: "{0}" Message: "{1}"

data.name: ClassnameMustMatchBasename
data.value: The base name of your output file, "{0}", does not match the base name used by the strongly typed resources, "{1}". In order for the strongly typed resources to work correctly, you will need to rename your output file to "{1}.resources".

data.name: ResponseFileDoesntExist
data.value: The specified response file doesn't exist. You passed in "{0}".

data.name: MalformedResponseFileName
MustProvideOutputDirectoryNotFilename
data.value: When specifying an assembly (.resources.dll, .dll or .exe) as input, an output directory must be specified. {0} appears to be an output filename but will be treated as a directory name. Use ResGen /? for usage information.

data.name: InvalidIfdef
data.value: Found an invalid #ifdef value, "{0}". ResGen supports very simple syntax currently, and doesn't include parentheses, || nor &&.

data.name: BeginSTRClassNamespace
data.value: Creating strongly typed resource class "{0}.{1}"...

data.name: BadFileExtensionNotOnWindows
data.value: The file named "{0}" does not have a known extension. Managed resource files must end in .ResX, .restext, .txt, or .resources. Response files must end in .rsp and be specified as @respFile.rsp.

data.name: BeginWriting
data.value: Writing resource file...

data.name: MultipleResponseFiles
data.value: You specified multiple response files; at most one is allowed.

data.name: ValidLanguages
data.value: Language names valid for the /str:<language> option are:

data.name: ImproperlyBuiltSatelliteAssembly
data.value: Satellite assembly "{2}" was built improperly. The manifest resource "{0}" will not be found by the ResourceManager. It must end in "{1}".

data.name: CompileAndSTRDontMix
data.value: Cannot use /compile & /str simultaneously if you specify a class name or an output file name to the /str switch as well as multiple input files to /compile. You would end up with duplicate classes or overwrite one of your classes.

data.name: CorruptOutput
data.value: Output file is possibly corrupt. Deleting "{0}"

data.name: StringsTagObsolete
data.value: The "[strings]" tag is no longer necessary in your text files. Please remove it.

data.name: OutputDirectoryMustExist
data.value: The specified output directory {0} does not exist.

data.name: MOTW
data.value: Couldn't process file {0} due to being in the Internet or Restricted zone or having the mark of the web on the file, use /allowUntrustedFiles if you want to process these files.

data.name: UnbalancedIfdefs
data.value: Found an #ifdef but not a matching #endif before reaching the end of the file. Unmatched #ifdef: "{0}".
